remarks: Properties that determine a left module.  See note in ~ isgrpd2 regarding the ` ph ` on hypotheses that name structure components. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Jun-2014.)
statement:
islmodd.v $e |- ( ph -> V = ( Base ` W ) ) $.
islmodd.a $e |- ( ph -> .+ = ( +g ` W ) ) $.
islmodd.f $e |- ( ph -> F = ( Scalar ` W ) ) $.
islmodd.s $e |- ( ph -> .x. = ( .s ` W ) ) $.
islmodd.b $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` F ) ) $.
islmodd.p $e |- ( ph -> .+^ = ( +g ` F ) ) $.
islmodd.t $e |- ( ph -> .X. = ( .r ` F ) ) $.
islmodd.u $e |- ( ph -> .1. = ( 1r ` F ) ) $.
islmodd.r $e |- ( ph -> F e. Ring ) $.
islmodd.l $e |- ( ph -> W e. Grp ) $.
islmodd.w $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B /\ y e. V ) -> ( x .x. y ) e. V ) $.
islmodd.c $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. V /\ z e. V ) ) -> ( x .x. ( y .+ z ) ) = ( ( x .x. y ) .+ ( x .x. z ) ) ) $.
islmodd.d $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B /\ z e. V ) ) -> ( ( x .+^ y ) .x. z ) = ( ( x .x. z ) .+ ( y .x. z ) ) ) $.
islmodd.e $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B /\ z e. V ) ) -> ( ( x .X. y ) .x. z ) = ( x .x. ( y .x. z ) ) ) $.
islmodd.g $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. V ) -> ( .1. .x. x ) = x ) $.
islmodd $p |- ( ph -> W e. LMod ) $.
$d .+ x y z $.
$d .+^ y z $.
$d .1. x $.
$d .X. y z $.
$d .x. x y z $.
$d B x y z $.
$d V x y z $.
$d W x $.
$d ph x y z $.
